headline: Samsung Electronics Leans Into AI Memory, Circular Devices And R&D Upside
summary: Samsung Electronics (KOSE:A005930) has started mass production of industry first HBM4 memory for high performance computing and AI workloads. The company has partnered with Getmobil to expand a second hand and refurbished electronics program in Turkey. Samsung has joined Applied Materials' planned US$5b EPIC Center to collaborate on next generation semiconductor process R&D. For you as an investor, these moves touch three core parts of Samsung Electronics' business: memory, devices, and...

headline: Semiconductor Manufacturing Equipment Research Report 2025: Market to More than Double to Reach $344.36 Billion by 2032, Driven by Proliferation of AI, HPC, and Data-Centric Workloads
summary: The global semiconductor manufacturing equipment market is expected to surge from USD 166.35 billion in 2025 to USD 344.36 billion by 2032, boasting a CAGR of 11.0%. Driving this growth is the rapid expansion of the automotive semiconductor sector, fueled by trends like EVs, autonomous driving, and enhanced connectivity. OSAT companies are forecasted to achieve the highest CAGR due to their role in advanced packaging, while testing equipment remains dominant in the back-end segment. Meanwhile, C
